title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.22 - Executive order no. 22: directing that the adjutant general order into active service the organizer militia to assist authorities in alleviating the effects of a severe snowstorm and guaranteeing public safety
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.22 - Executive order no. 22: directing that the adjutant general order into active service the organizer militia to assist authorities in alleviating the effects of a severe snowstorm and guaranteeing public safety

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the Governor is Commander-in-chief of the Militia
of the State, pursuant to the Constitution of the State, as restated in section
3
of the Military

Law; and
WHEREAS, pursuant to the provisions of section
6
of the Military

Law, the Governor as Commander-in-chief of the Militia has the power to order
into the active service of the State in case of disaster or imminent danger
thereof, such units of the organized militia which may be necessary to assist
civil authority in disaster recovery efforts; and
WHEREAS, beginning on January 7, 1996, a severe snowstorm
impacted New York City and the counties of Westchester, Putnam, Rockland, Orange, Nassau, and Suffolk disrupting vital public transportation and safety
systems; and
WHEREAS, I have declared a disaster emergency in the
aforementioned areas; and the public interest requires that the organized
militia assist in alleviating the effects of the snowstorm and maintaining the
public safety; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by paragraph one of
section
6
of the Military

Law, effective January 7, 1996, do hereby order Brigadier General John H. Fenimore, V, The Adjutant General, or, in his absence, his designee, to order
into the active service of the State, for such period, to such extent and in
such manner as he may deem necessary, all or any part of the organized militia
to meet this emergency. 1. Brigadier

General John H. Fenimore, V, The Adjutant General, or, in his absence, his
designee, is appointed commander of all personnel ordered into the active
service of the State. 2. Units and
members of the organized militia who shall perform state active duty by order
of The Adjutant General will immediately assemble at their local armories when
so ordered, and will remain assembled pending further orders as to their
disposition by The Adjutant General or his designee. 3. All enlistments, reenlistments or
voluntary extensions of enlistments which expire after 7 January, 1996, or
during the period for which the members are currently ordered into the active
service of the state are hereby extended for the duration of such duty in the
active service of the State. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: January 7, 1996
